paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: LQTS with QTc ranging from 0.43 s to 0.48 s

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Two family members, I:1 and II:2, had QTc of 0.47 s or higher.
Two family members, I:1 and II:2, had QTc of 0.47 s or higher.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Syncopal episode reported once at age 17.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Syncopal episodes were reported in carriers I-1 (once while on a high protein diet), II-3 (several at the age of 11), and III-3 (once at the age of 17), but not in other carriers.
Syncopal episodes were reported in carriers I-1 (once while on a high protein diet), II-3 (several at the age of 11), and III-3 (once at the age of 17), but not in other carriers.
Bradycardia, defined as a resting heart rate of under 60 beats per minute, was seen in five of seven carriers with an average heart rate of 46 beats/min by resting ECG.
Bradycardia, defined as a resting heart rate of under 60 beats per minute, was seen in five of seven carriers with an average heart rate of 46 beats/min by resting ECG.

functional_data.summary: The presence of A490T and K897T variants in cis orientation is associated with shorter QTc and fewer symptoms.

variants.segregation_data: A490T co-segregated with K897T in family QW2648.
variants.additional_notes: The normal family members did not carry either of the two variants.
key_quotes: Notably, we have found that SNP K897T interacts with mutation A490T in cis orientation.
Seven carriers for A490T and the minor allele T of SNP K897T showed shorter QTc and fewer symptoms than carriers with A490T or A490P (P < 0.0001).

patients.phenotype: LQTS with prolonged QTc of 0.596–0.687 s

individual_records.phenotype_details: Prolonged QTc of 0.596–0.687 s, developed polymorphic VT.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The proband in the family was a 75-year-old female with a prolonged QTc of 0.596–0.687 s and left bundle branch block.

functional_data.summary: The insertion mutation is associated with significant cardiac events.

variants.additional_notes: The mutation was neither present in three normal family members nor 200 controls.
key_quotes: The proband in the family was a 75-year-old female with a prolonged QTc of 0.596–0.687 s and left bundle branch block.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data extracted from the main text.
